author: Special Correspondent
text:
Communist Party of India (CPI), Puducherry unit secretary R.Viswanathan on Monday said the safety of women became a question mark during erstwhile Congress and the present All India NR Congress Governments.

In a statement, Mr. Viswanathan alleged, “The instances of subjecting school girls to sexual harassment and forcing women into immoral acts have been increasing. Particularly, Puducherry has been pushed to the situation of where there is no security forwomen who go alone.”

He added that Women and Children Department, Women’s Commission and All Women Police Stations have been functioning for namesake. While several States give 50 per cent reservation to women in local bodies, the AINRC has not come forward to conduct local body polls and failed to give such reservation besides betraying women, Mr. Viswanathan said.

The CPI leader said there is no security for women who go alone in Puducherry
title: ‘Women’s safety overlooked in UT by succesive govts’
